Dear Ms. Emmorey:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff punched a youth in the face.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/2/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported she was restrained in her bedroom by Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Youth A reported Staff 2 placed her in a standing restraint and
Staff 1 assisted. Staff 1 and Staff 2 transitioned Youth A into a
supine restraint. Youth A told Staff 1 and Staff 2 while in the
restraint she would hit them once she was released. Youth A
reported while in the supine restraint she was moving to get under
the bed that was next to her. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
released her from the restraint. Staff 2 left the bedroom after the
restraint. Youth A reported she got up from under the bed and
punched Staff 1 and Staff 1 punched her back in her left eye.
Youth A reported Staff 1 punched her with a closed fist one time.
Youth A reported she did not want Staff 1 to get in trouble and
believed Staff 1 punched her back as a reaction to being punched.
Youth A reported there were no other witnesses as Staff 2 and
Case Manager came into the bedroom right after Staff 1 punched
her. Youth A reported she told Staff 2, Case Manager, Chief
Administrator, and Medical Technician about Staff 1 punching her.
Youth A reported her left eye hurt. Youth A reported she told
Nurse on 12/1/2024. Youth A reported she was seen by Nurse
following the restraint. Youth A reported her thumb hurt as when
2

she was in the standing restraint with Staff 2, Youth A grabbed
Staff 2’s hair and Staff 1 did a finger peel to get her to let go of
Staff 1’s hair. Youth A was unable to explain how Staff 1 did the
finger peel to get her to release Staff 2’s hair. Youth A denied Staff
1 pushing her following Youth A punching Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/2/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1
reported Youth A was in her bedroom with Chief Administrator,
Staff 2, and Case Manager. Case Manager came out of the
bedroom and asked Staff 1 to go assist. Staff 1 reported when
she entered the bedroom Youth A was trying to get to the outlets.
Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2 stood in front of the outlets to
block them. Staff 1 reported she was unsure what escalated to
result in the restraint however Staff 2 placed Youth A in a standing
restraint. Youth A began pulling Staff 2’s hair while in the
restraint. Staff 1 reported Youth A had her hands wrapped around
Staff 2’s hair so she attempted the finger peel technique however
it was not working as Youth A’s whole hand was wrapped around
Staff 2’s dreads. Staff 1 pulled back on Youth A’s thumb to peel
the thumb back and Youth A released Staff 2’s hair. Staff 1
reported she and Staff 2 transitioned Youth A into a supine
restraint. Youth A began “scooting” in the supine restraint to get
under the bed. Staff 1 and Staff 2 released Youth A from the
restraint. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 left the bedroom. Youth A told
Staff 1 she was going to hit her and walked up to Staff 1 and
punched her in the face with her right hand. Staff 1 reported she
put up her arms as Youth A went to swing on her again with her
left hand. Staff 1 reported she “swiped her hands down and
pushed her back”. Staff 1 demonstrated the swipe hands down
and her arms being up in front of her face and swing her arms to
the side as Youth A came at her to punch her causing her arms to
guide Youth A’s arms down. Staff 1 demonstrated she then
placed her hands on Youth A’s shoulders and pushed her back.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2 and Case Manager ran into the bedroom
and told her to step out. Staff 1 reported she did not punch Youth
A in the eye or anywhere on her body. Staff 1 reported she was
unsure if when she used her hands to swipe Youth A’s arms down
if her hand hit Youth A’s face.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/2/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
reported Youth A had a sharp object and went into her bedroom.
Staff 2 and Case Manager followed Youth A to her bedroom.
Youth A pulled two nails out of her pocket and began trying to
screw the nails into the bedframe with a metal piece from the top
3

of a pencil. Staff 2 reported he was able to take one of the nails
from Youth A’s hand and then asked for the second nail and
Youth A gave it to him. Staff 2 reported Youth A would not give up
the small metal piece. Youth A began using the metal piece to
surface cut on her arm. Staff 2 reported while Youth A was
holding the metal piece, he went to take it out of her hand and
Youth A began going towards the outlets. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
came into the room with him, and he and Staff 1 began standing in
front of the outlets to block Youth A from accessing the outlets
while trying to verbally de-escalate. Staff 2 reported Youth A
began swing at him and he placed Youth A in a standing restraint.
Youth A was able to get a hold of Staff 2’s hair while in the
restraint. Staff 1 assisted Staff 2 by using the finger peel to get
Youth A to let go of his hair. Staff 2 reported once his hair was
release, Staff 1 and Staff 2 transitioned Youth A into a supine
restraint. While in the supine restraint Youth A started “scooting”
and was moving under the bed. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 1
released Youth A from the restraint. Staff 2 reported he left the
bedroom to get Case Manager to assist. Staff 2 reported while he
was out of the bedroom, he heard Youth A get up and then a
sound like someone got hit. Staff 2 reported he and Case
Manager ran back to the bedroom and Staff 1 came walking out
holding her hands on her face. Youth A was saying “I told you I
would hit you”. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 seemed surprised that
Youth A hit her when she walked out of the bedroom. Staff 2
reported Youth A never told him Staff 1 punched her. Staff 2
reported he talked to Staff 1 after the incident and Staff 1 told him
she put her arms up after Youth A punched her as Youth A
continued to move toward her. Staff 1 told Staff 2 she pushed
Youth A back and was unsure when she pushed Youth A back if
her hand caught Youth A’s face.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Nurse reported she met
with Youth A following the restraint to examine her. Youth A
complained of thumb pain and was offered Ibuprofen and an ice
pack. Youth A declined the Ibuprofen but accepted the ice pack.
Nurse reported Youth A had full range of motion in her thumb and
no swelling. Nurse reported Youth A did not report what
happened to her thumb. Nurse examined Youth A again the day
after the restraint and Youth A had swelling in the meaty part of
her thumb. Nurse recommended Youth A continue to use ice
packs as needed. Nurse reported Youth A did not report or
complain of any eye pain or being hit in the eye to her. Nurse
reported she was sitting right next to Youth A when she examined
her the day of the restraint, and she completed a full visual
4

examine of Youth A and did not see any other injuries. Nurse
asked Youth A if anything else hurt other than her thumb and
Youth A did not report any other injuries.
Assistant Medical Manager was interviewed via telephone on
12/4/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Assistant
Medical Manager reported she saw Youth A on Wednesday and
Saturday last week. On Wednesday Youth A Informed Assistant
Medical Manager her eye hurt. Assistant Medical Manager
offered Youth A Tylenol and an ice pack however Youth A
declined both. Assistant Medical Manager reported Youth A did
not tell her what happened to cause her eye to hurt, nor did she
ask. On Saturday Assistant Medical Manager came into the
facility and Youth A had a washcloth on her eye. Assistant
Medical Manager examined Youth A and reported Youth A’s
optical socket on the top and bottom was swollen and looked to be
blackish in color. Assistant Medical Manager asked Youth A what
happened, and Youth A told Assistant Medical Manager she did
not want to talk about it. Youth A was provided with Ibuprofen and
an ice pack. A little while later, Youth A approached Assistant
Medical Manager and quietly told her Staff 1 had punched her.
Assistant Medical Manager reported she asked Youth A when this
happened, and Youth A was unable to recall when Staff 1
punched her. Youth A told Assistant Medical Manager she did not
want to talk about it anymore. A second time later in the day,
Youth A approached Assistant Medical Manager and told her Staff
1 punched her in her bedroom however Youth A reported she
thought it was just a reaction as Youth A had just punched Staff 1.
Assistant Medical Manager reported in her professional medical
opinion she was unable to say if the bruising around the eye on
Saturday was a result from a possible hit earlier in the week as
timeframes for bruising is different as it depends on the
individual’s thickness of skin and iron levels.
Case Manager was interviewed via telephone on 12/3/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Case Manager reported she
did not see Staff 1 hit Youth A. Case Manager was at the facility
when the alleged incident occurred and reported she walked into
Youth A’s bedroom and saw “arms moving”. Case Manager
reported Youth A told her Staff 1 punched her in the eye. Case
Manager reported she looked Youth A over after Youth A reported
this to her and Youth A’s “left eye was red and a little puffy”. Case
Manager reported she met with Youth A again approximately an
hour and a half after the incident and Youth A’s eye was no longer
red or puffy. Youth A told Case Manager her eye hurt and
showed Case Manager that it hurt near the brow bone. Case
5

Manager reported Youth A was assessed by Nurse. Case
Manager reported she saw Youth A the following day and Youth A
complained of eye pain. Case Manager reported she also saw
Youth A Saturday night and Youth A complained of eye pain and
Youth A’s eye was “goopy and puffy”. Case Manager provided
Youth A with a warm washcloth to apply compression to her eye
and notified medical staff at the facility.
Therapist was interviewed via telephone on 12/3/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist reported she has
met with Youth A for therapy a day after Youth A was restrained.
Therapist reported Youth A asked her if she had heard a staff
punched her. Therapist reported Youth A told her that she had an
item to self-harm with and she hit Staff 1 and Staff 1 hit her back.
Therapist reported she did not see any injuries on Youth A when
she met with her. Therapist reported Youth A did not mention
anything about her thumb hurting.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 12/2/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
via telephone on 1/8/2025. Chief Administrator reported she was
at the facility and went to assist with Youth A as she was informed
Youth A was “digging at outlets”. Chief Administrator reported she
has a good rapport with Youth A. Chief Administrator went to
Youth A’s bedroom and Staff 1 and Staff 2 were present in the
bedroom with Youth A. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were standing in front
to block the outlets to prevent Youth A from getting to the outlets.
Chief Administrator reported she also began blocking an outlet
and attempted to verbally de-escalate Youth A as Youth A had a
metal piece that she was attempting to put into the outlet. Chief
Administrator reported her attempts were not helping and she felt
it was best to leave the area as there did not need to be three
staff. Chief Administrator was not present when Youth A was
restrained or allegedly punched by Staff 1. Chief Administrator
reported she has reviewed facility policies and procedures, and
the facility does not have a policy or procedure that specifies
prohibit intervention to include any type of physical punishment
including, but not limited to hitting or striking, throwing, kicking,
pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Video Reviewed:
There is no video footage as the incident occurred in the bedroom
and bedrooms do not have video cameras.
Documents Reviewed:
6

• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 200990238 for Youth A dated 11/25/2024 was
consistent with Staff 1, and Staff 2 interviews and
documented Staff 1 pushed Youth A away after Youth A
punched Staff 1 and attempted to punch Staff 1 again
moving closer to Youth A.
• River Oak Youth Center Safe Crisis Management and
Physical Intervention Policy and Procedure: Staff directing
and applying physical intervention must be properly trained
in DCWL approved de-escalation and restraint techniques.
• Email dated 1/6/2025 from Chief Administrator states the
facility does not have a behavior management policy
addressing CCI licensing Rule 400.4158-1-a-ii.
• Safe Crisis Management Manual does not have a swiping
technique to block a punch.
• Progress Note for Youth A dated 11/30/2024 written by
Assistant Medical Manager: Youth A complained of a sore
left eye on 11/27/2024 and was offered an ice pack and
Motrin which Youth A denied. On 11/30/2024 Youth A
complained her eye was still sore. Youth A was assessed
and around her eye was swollen (the orbital socket) and
appeared to have a black eye. Youth A was provided an
ice pack and Ibuprofen for selling.
• Youth Opportunity Safety Response Plan for Youth A dated
11/26/2024: Youth A and Staff 1 are not to be left alone.
Staff 1 is not to be left alone with any youth pending the
investigation.
• Written Statement by Staff 1 dated 11/26/2024: Youth A
walked up and hit Staff 1 in the face. Youth A attempted
another punch, but Staff 1 put her hands in front of her own
face to prevent another hit to the face by Youth A. As this
was happening Youth A got closer to Staff 1. Staff 1
pushed Youth A away.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had one discipline dated
11/24/2024 due to not following the facilities policy on
locking up personal items. Staff 1 received the required
SCM training on 10/9/2024, 10/10/2024, and 10/14/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 reported pushing
Youth A away from her. It is unclear if Staff 1 hit/punched Youth A
in the face as Youth A reported Staff 1 punched her in her left eye
after Youth A punched Staff 1. Staff 1 denied punching Youth A
and reported she put up her arms as Youth A went to swing on
7

her again with her left hand. Staff 1 reported she “swiped her
hands down and pushed her back”. Staff 1 reported she was
unsure if when she used her hands to swipe Youth A’s arms down
if her hand hit Youth A’s face. There were no other witnesses in
the bedroom and no video footage due to no video cameras being
located in bedrooms.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to update internal policy to
address prohibited interventions that include any type of physical
punishment including hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling,
or pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Health status assessment; notification; debriefing; reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163
Section (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
Description by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The incident report was not approved within the 72-hour
timeframe.
Investigation Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 200990238 for Youth A dated 11/25/2024 was not
approved as of 12/3/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the incident report was
not approved within the 72-hour timeframe.
Conclusion Violation Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
